Interface FormalSystemImporter

All Known Implementing Classes:
CoqImporter, MetamathImporter, QedeqImporter
public interface FormalSystemImporter
Interface for importing formal systems from external verification tools.

Importers parse files from formal verification systems (Coq, Metamath, Qedeq) and convert them into JScience logic structures.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Silvere Martin-Michiellot, Gemini AI (Google DeepMind)

  • Method Details

    • importSystem

      Map<String,Object> importSystem(Reader reader) throws IOException, FormalSystemImporter.ParseException
      Imports a formal system from the specified reader.
      Parameters:
      reader - the reader to import from
      Returns:
      a map of module names to their axioms/theorems
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      FormalSystemImporter.ParseException - if the input format is invalid

    • importSystem

      default Map<String,Object> importSystem(File file) throws IOException, FormalSystemImporter.ParseException
      Imports a system from a file.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to read from
      Returns:
      the imported system components
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      FormalSystemImporter.ParseException - if a parsing error occurs

    • importSystem

      default Map<String,Object> importSystem(String filePath) throws IOException, FormalSystemImporter.ParseException
      Imports a system from a file path.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file
      Returns:
      the imported system components
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      FormalSystemImporter.ParseException - if a parsing error occurs

    • getSupportedExtensions

      String[] getSupportedExtensions()
      Returns the file extensions this importer can handle.
      Returns:
      array of file extensions (e.g., [".v", ".vo"])
